Class GameLoop

java.lang.Object
com.example.GameLoop
public class GameLoop extends Object
Represents the main game loop that manages updates to the game logic. The loop runs on a separate thread and ensures consistent updates to the game state.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    GameLoop(SaveFile saveFile)
    Constructs a GameLoop with the given save file.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    GameManager

    Retrieves the GameManager instance associated with the game loop.

    Stops the game loop by setting the running status to false.

      public GameLoop(SaveFile saveFile)
      Constructs a GameLoop with the given save file.
      Parameters:

  • Method Details

    • isRunning

      public boolean isRunning()
      Checks if the game loop is currently running.
      Returns:
      true if the game loop is running; false otherwise

    • setRunning

      public void setRunning(boolean running)
      Sets the running status of the game loop.
      Parameters:
      running - true to start the loop; false to stop it

    • getPlay

      public GamePlay getPlay()
      Retrieves the current GamePlay instance.
      Returns:
      the current GamePlay instance

    • setPlay

      public void setPlay(GamePlay play)
      Sets the current GamePlay instance.
      Parameters:
      play - the GamePlay instance to set

    • start

      public void start(SaveFile saveFile)
      Starts the game loop and initializes the GamePlay instance using the given save file.
      Parameters:
      saveFile - the save file to initialize the game state

    • run

      public void run()
      Executes the game loop logic on a separate thread. Handles updates to the game state at a consistent rate.

    • update

      public void update()
      Updates the game logic by delegating to the GamePlay instance.

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops the game loop by setting the running status to false.

    • getGameManager

      public GameManager getGameManager()
      Retrieves the GameManager instance associated with the game loop.
      Returns:
      the GameManager instance
